channel.title: "Show more options" dialog. Eclipse 639

item.title: "Show more options" dialog. Eclipse 639
item.dc:creator: @Brockz Brockz
item.description:
@Brockz wrote:

I added a portal with a dialog that teleports you to the location of your choosing. When I talk to it it says the first dialog and when I click “click to continue it freezes”. I know I need the show more options dialog, but I don’t know how to use it. Can someone explain to me how I use it? Thanks.
My dialogManager.Java

case 20072: sendOptionDialogue(player, new int[]{20073, 20074, 20075, 20076, 20077, 20078, 20079, 20080}, "Slayer Tower", "Edgeville", "Lumbridge", "Falador", "Bandos", "Zamorak", "Armadyl", "Saradomin"); return true; case 20073: TeleportHandler.telePlayer(player, 3426, 3538, 0, 0, 0, false, 1706); return false; case 20074: TeleportHandler.telePlayer(player, 3087, 3495, 0, 0, 0, false, 1706); return false; case 20075: TeleportHandler.telePlayer(player, 3221, 3218, 0, 0, 0, false, 1706); return false; case 20076: TeleportHandler.telePlayer(player, 2965, 3376, 0, 0, 0, false, 1706); return false; case 20077: TeleportHandler.telePlayer(player, 2858, 5354, 2, 0, 0, false, 1706); return false; case 20078: TeleportHandler.telePlayer(player, 2925, 5334, 2, 0, 0, false, 1706); return false; case 20079: TeleportHandler.telePlayer(player, 2839, 5292, 2, 0, 0, false, 1706); return false; case 20080: TeleportHandler.telePlayer(player, 2910, 5265, 2, 0, 0, false, 1706); return false;

Read full topic
